text: may not be in the initial release but I see the value in making it happen, and wouldn’t be hard to implement.

it is a friday after all, guess I’ll go home. jk I’ll see about making this be in the first release for the feature that hits the stable build.

The initial release of the feature will just be in the beta build will likely be just the button, but once the shortcut is in I’ll get that in there too.
Huge congrats on the milestone! :trophy: Do good work and you'll build a tribe :applause: KEEP GOING! #ThisIsExciting

Anyone here got experience with doing web push notifications? been considering offering them as an opt-in in the chrome extension as a way to simply point out when new features are released, or to communicate to Beta testers - Hey this feature is now in here, let us know what you think.

we do have some code, I think AJ wrote it, that we can put our releases info into our Options page. for the extension which is nice, but requires someone to go looking for the info.
I've played around with onesignal before on push notifications. Seemed pretty easy to do with that. <https://onesignal.com>
yea I’ve been playing around with exactly this on a wordpress site. just not sure how well that would work with a chrome extension, due to the permissions/security they require
